intro: Medicago apiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed clover, is a perennial legume native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically narrow and have a pointed tip, and its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. This plant is well adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Medicago apiculata is often used in forage systems and as a cover crop due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
